title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 8600.3 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 8600.3 - Definitions

State Regulations
(a) Master
application project information form means that document described in
subdivision 1 of section
881
of the

Executive Law of the State of New York and in this Part. (b) Preapplication conference means the
conduct of that activity as described in section
882
of the

Executive Law, which takes place pending the submission of application forms
for permits. The preapplication conference is intended to provide both the
applicant and the agencies an opportunity to discuss in a free and open manner
a projected business undertaking project or activity. (c) Office means the Office of Business

Permits. (d) Director means the

Director of the Office of Business Permits. (e) Interested State agency means any
department, board, bureau, commission, division, office, council, or agency of
the State, or a public benefit corporation or public authority at least one of
whose members is appointed by the Governor, and who has indicated a potential
interest in a business undertaking pursuant to subdivision 4 of section
881
of the

Executive Law of the State of New York and this Part. (f) Permit means the whole or part of any

State agency permit, license, certificate, approval, registration, charter or
similar form of permission required by law or by State agency rules and
regulations having the force and effect of law. (g) Person means any individual, proprietorship, association, cooperative, corporation, non profit organization, State or local government agency, and any other organization required to obtain
one or more permits. (h) Applicant
means any person acting on his behalf or authorized to act on behalf of any
other person for the purpose of securing a permit. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
8600.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
